message:
[Solved] I am facing this problem for 18 hours now ... it was windows 10 build 10125 asked me to restart ... took a very long time restarting ... and faild to boot again :( 
Tried reinstalling the windows ... and keep old files ... formating the whole C and installing the windows ... tried installing another OS-blue unlovely screen appears- ... tried advanced system restore ... tried repairing ...tried resetting ... nothing better happens
any advice please ?

data.message:
grab linux b2a   e3ml bootable USB  ubuntu mslan .. (u dont need to install it ) 
http://www.ubuntu.com/download/desktop/try-ubuntu-before-you-install

5od el data bt3tak 3la ay external hard  b3den shof ht3ml a :D

Do you have multiple disks or partitions? Are you sure it's loading from the C: or from this disk at all?
Double check the disk first, then use the "fdisk" tool (by bringing the command prompt after you open the Windows CD installer, I think it's F3 or F10 that brings it, google it, and google FDisk). With FDisk you can make sure the partition you want is the primary one and can actually delete and create it. If you can clean the entire disk (the command "clean" inside fdisk") do it as well.

I am very thankful for your responds :)
It was the 350MB system partition problem ... I deleted it .. the C 
And recreated them ...installed the system ... the charm happened and everything is fixed ^_^
Upgrade to Linux and have a more enlightened computing experience :)

I am not so good with CLI ... I use windows for 15.5 years now :D !
you think I can survive in Linux sea ?
why I use "I" too much :D !!! any advice to avoid that habit ?

Yeah, not everything in Linux dependant on CLI, plus, you can pick it up in no time. 

Unless you are a designer or a gamer, Linux is better experience overall (try elementary os, it's like a Mac)
In linux there is your salvation..

Osama Soliman Linux has become so much more user friendly and has so much documentation and help, including such a helpful community that you will not only survive, you will flourish. Also, you can code .Net on Linux as well as any other language, you can use MS Office documents and it uses very little system resources and is extremely stable. I advise you to try ubuntu as the link posted above, I think you will be blown away. Oh, and it is all free forever :)
P.S. Free as in Freedom, but also, Free Beer :)

Excuse me commenters. This thread is not about moving to Linux. I'd recommend if you want to talk about that you can open a new thread on the topic.

This is a question about certain software. Suggesting to completely replace the software with a radically different one is an overkill IMHO.

Not to mention that there is a possibility that this is a booting issue unrelated to disk configuration not the OS itself.

Try to get any linux iso and boot life cd or life usb
Save your files on another partion
Wipe the C Clean Using GParted
And try to re install

Just to avoid any arguments, I am seriously speaking, as a 25 year window user as well as acclaimed expert in my field and lover of all things Microsoft. I did find Linux so much easier to install and so much more stable and even the beta versions were more stable even than some final Windows versions. Also, the term free is purely objective as it is really free
